hint: Push selective filters (date, demographics, location) as early as possible into joins using explicit join syntax, reduce intermediate row counts through predicate pushdown before aggregation.
Isolate highly selective dimension tables (date_dim, customer_demographics) into CTEs with pre-applied filters before joining to the fact table, using explicit JOINs for clarity.
Materialize all filtered dimension subsets and pre-filtered fact rows into separate CTEs, then perform joins on reduced datasets to minimize hash table sizes and memory pressure.
Transform the OR condition on demographics into a UNION ALL of two separate subqueries, potentially enabling better filter pushdown and index usage for each demographic pattern.
